name: More Old Ads Quiz | Marketing | 10 Questions

questions.text: These cigarette smokers 'would rather fight than switch'.
questions.explanation:
Tareyton.

	The print ads showed 'black eyes' to drive home the point.

questions.text: Finish the phrase: 'I'd walk a mile for a ...'
Fill in the blank: 'When you're out of -, you're out of beer'.
questions.explanation:
Schlitz.

	They also called themselves a 'beautiful beer'.

questions.text: What product referred to itself as 'the other guys'?
questions.explanation:
Goodrich.

	They kidded about not having a blimp.

questions.text: 'Be careful how you use it' applies to what product?
questions.explanation:
Hai Karate.

	A short-lived after shave.

questions.text: Who said that 'a little dab will do ya'?
Which mint was 'two mints in one'?
questions.explanation:
Certs.

	Breath mint and candy mint.

questions.text: Who offered a 'taste of happiness on a bun'?
questions.explanation:
Wetson's.

	Before Burger King and McDonald's destroyed the competition.
